clusters.title: Baby dies of whooping cough after mother not vaccinated while pregnant
clusters.neutral_headline: Baby dies of whooping cough after mother not vaccinated while pregnant

items.title: Baby dies of whooping cough after mother not vaccinated while pregnant
items.standfirst: The first death from the illness this year comes as vaccination rates among children have declined.
items.content: The first death from the illness this year comes as vaccination rates among children have declined.

items.title: British baby dies from whooping cough as vaccination rates fall
items.standfirst: Infant’s mother had not been vaccinated against the highly infectious disease, which affects the lungs and airwaysA baby in the UK has died from whooping cough, marking the first such death in the country this year.The infant’s mother had not been vaccinated against the highly infectious disease, which affects the lungs and airways. This death occurred as vaccination rates among children and pregnant women in the UK have fallen to their lowest levels in 15 years. Continue reading...
items.content: Infant’s mother had not been vaccinated against the highly infectious disease, which affects the lungs and airwaysA baby in the UK has died from whooping cough, marking the first such death in the country this year.The infant’s mother had not been vaccinated against the highly infectious disease, which affects the lungs and airways. This death occurred as vaccination rates among children and pregnant women in the UK have fallen to their lowest levels in 15 years. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A baby in the UK died from whooping cough this year.
The mother of the baby had not been vaccinated.
Vaccination rates among children have declined.
The death is the first of its kind this year.
The report highlights the importance of vaccination.

clusters.title: Top FDA official demands removal of YouTube videos in which he criticized Covid vaccines
clusters.neutral_headline: Top FDA official demands removal of YouTube videos in which he criticized Covid vaccines

items.title: Top FDA official demands removal of YouTube videos in which he criticized Covid vaccines
items.standfirst: Channel was an attempt to ‘preserve’ what Trump officials in current Trump administration said during the pandemicA top official at the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) demanded the removal of YouTube videos of himself that were published by a physician and writer who has been critical of medical misinformation and public health officials in the Trump administration, according to a YouTube notice that was seen by the Guardian.Jonathan Howard, a neurologist and psychiatrist in New York City, received an email from YouTube on Friday night, which stated that Vinay Prasad, who is the FDA’s top vaccine regulator, had demanded the removal of six videos of himself from Howard’s YouTube channel. Continue reading...
items.content: Channel was an attempt to ‘preserve’ what Trump officials in current Trump administration said during the pandemicA top official at the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) demanded the removal of YouTube videos of himself that were published by a physician and writer who has been critical of medical misinformation and public health officials in the Trump administration, according to a YouTube notice that was seen by the Guardian.Jonathan Howard, a neurologist and psychiatrist in New York City, received an email from YouTube on Friday night, which stated that Vinay Prasad, who is the FDA’s top vaccine regulator, had demanded the removal of six videos of himself from Howard’s YouTube channel. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A top FDA official demanded the removal of YouTube videos.
The videos featured the official criticizing COVID vaccines.
The videos were published by a physician and writer.
The writer has been critical of medical misinformation.
The official's request was related to his own content.

clusters.title: Former CDC official ‘only sees harm’ to public health under RFK Jr’s leadership
clusters.neutral_headline: Former CDC Official Warns of Health Risks Under RFK Jr

items.title: Former CDC official ‘only sees harm’ to public health under RFK Jr’s leadership
items.standfirst: Demetre Daskalakis, who resigned after White House fired CDC chief, cautions against ‘undoing of vaccination’ to ABCThe former immunizations director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has warned of the future of American health under the leadership of Donald Trump’s health secretary, Robert F Kennedy Jr.In an interview on Sunday with ABC, Demetre Daskalakis – who resigned this week in protest over the White House’s firing of CDC director Susan Monarez – said: “From my vantage point as a doctor who’s taken the Hippocratic Oath, I only see harm coming.” Continue reading...
items.content: Demetre Daskalakis, who resigned after White House fired CDC chief, cautions against ‘undoing of vaccination’ to ABCThe former immunizations director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has warned of the future of American health under the leadership of Donald Trump’s health secretary, Robert F Kennedy Jr.In an interview on Sunday with ABC, Demetre Daskalakis – who resigned this week in protest over the White House’s firing of CDC director Susan Monarez – said: “From my vantage point as a doctor who’s taken the Hippocratic Oath, I only see harm coming.” Continue reading...

ai_summary: Demetre Daskalakis resigned from CDC after White House fired CDC chief.
Daskalakis expressed concern about potential harm to public health.
He cited his Hippocratic Oath as the basis for his concerns.
The concerns relate to the leadership of Robert F Kennedy Jr.
Kennedy is Donald Trump's appointed Secretary of Health and Human Services.

clusters.title: Vegan v carnivore diets – the jury is out | Letters
clusters.neutral_headline: Vegan and Carnivore Diets Debate Continues in Letters

items.title: Vegan v carnivore diets – the jury is out | Letters
items.standfirst: Anne Tropper advocates nose-to-tail eating, while Rendel Harris says going vegan is the only way to be kind to other speciesA “bowl of cereal with skimmed milk, a Greek yoghurt and a lean chicken breast” – doesn’t that epitomise a “fad diet” (The Guardian view on the carnivore diet: red meat for influencers, but bad news for health, 25 August)? Ultraprocessed, unsustainable and wasteful – what is supposed to happen to most of the chicken and the precious dairy fat? I shall be sticking to the nose-to-tail red meat, butter and eggs that have restored my health. I suspect that this trend is powered by personal experience more than by influencers. Anne TropperRopley, Hampshire• Adele Parks’ account of converting to pescatarianism explains how she demonstrated for “beauty without cruelty” (A moment that changed me: I gave up meat at 16 – and learned how to say no, 27 August). But, as she still eats fish and dairy, she apparently doesn’t believe in food without cruelty. If you really want to be kind to other species, go vegan. Otherwise you’re simply saying that your form of cruelty is acceptable while others aren’t.Rendel HarrisLondon Continue reading...
items.content: Anne Tropper advocates nose-to-tail eating, while Rendel Harris says going vegan is the only way to be kind to other speciesA “bowl of cereal with skimmed milk, a Greek yoghurt and a lean chicken breast” – doesn’t that epitomise a “fad diet” (The Guardian view on the carnivore diet: red meat for influencers, but bad news for health, 25 August)? Ultraprocessed, unsustainable and wasteful – what is supposed to happen to most of the chicken and the precious dairy fat? I shall be sticking to the nose-to-tail red meat, butter and eggs that have restored my health. I suspect that this trend is powered by personal experience more than by influencers. Anne TropperRopley, Hampshire• Adele Parks’ account of converting to pescatarianism explains how she demonstrated for “beauty without cruelty” (A moment that changed me: I gave up meat at 16 – and learned how to say no, 27 August). But, as she still eats fish and dairy, she apparently doesn’t believe in food without cruelty. If you really want to be kind to other species, go vegan. Otherwise you’re simply saying that your form of cruelty is acceptable while others aren’t.Rendel HarrisLondon Continue reading...

ai_summary: One letter advocates for nose-to-tail eating for health benefits.
Another letter suggests veganism is the only kind choice for animals.
A writer shares their experience converting to pescatarianism.
The writer believes in food without cruelty.
The debate highlights differing views on dietary choices.

clusters.title: Teachers must be trained to use defibrillators to keep our children safe | Letter
clusters.neutral_headline: Letter Urges Defibrillator Training for Teachers in Schools

items.title: Teachers must be trained to use defibrillators to keep our children safe | Letter
items.standfirst: Mark King urges the government to provide training on this life-saving equipment as the school year beginsChildren across England are preparing to return to school this week following the summer break, but parents should be concerned for their safety and wellbeing while they are in school.After years of campaigning after the tragic death of my son Oliver to sudden cardiac arrest, I strongly welcomed the commitment given by the previous government to ensure that all state-funded schools across England received life-saving defibrillators. The rollout of the programme was significant and marked a giant step forward in improving emergency medical readiness, and potentially saving lives in schools across England. Continue reading...
items.content: Mark King urges the government to provide training on this life-saving equipment as the school year beginsChildren across England are preparing to return to school this week following the summer break, but parents should be concerned for their safety and wellbeing while they are in school.After years of campaigning after the tragic death of my son Oliver to sudden cardiac arrest, I strongly welcomed the commitment given by the previous government to ensure that all state-funded schools across England received life-saving defibrillators. The rollout of the programme was significant and marked a giant step forward in improving emergency medical readiness, and potentially saving lives in schools across England. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A letter writer urges government to provide defibrillator training.
The writer's son died from sudden cardiac arrest.
The writer welcomes the previous government's commitment.
The commitment was to provide defibrillators in schools.
Training could potentially save lives in emergency situations.

clusters.title: Doctors find drug that is better than aspirin at preventing heart attacks
clusters.neutral_headline: Drug Found Better Than Aspirin for Heart Attack Prevention

items.title: Doctors find drug that is better than aspirin at preventing heart attacks
items.standfirst: Discovery that clopidogrel is a more effective blood thinner could transform health guidelines worldwideDoctors have found a drug that is better than aspirin at preventing heart attacks and strokes, in a discovery that could transform health guidelines worldwide.For decades, millions of people have been advised to take aspirin to reduce their risk of experiencing a serious cardiovascular event. A daily low-dose aspirin makes blood less sticky and helps prevent heart attacks and strokes. Continue reading...
items.content: Discovery that clopidogrel is a more effective blood thinner could transform health guidelines worldwideDoctors have found a drug that is better than aspirin at preventing heart attacks and strokes, in a discovery that could transform health guidelines worldwide.For decades, millions of people have been advised to take aspirin to reduce their risk of experiencing a serious cardiovascular event. A daily low-dose aspirin makes blood less sticky and helps prevent heart attacks and strokes. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Doctors discovered clopidogrel is more effective than aspirin.
The discovery could transform global health guidelines.
Aspirin has been a standard preventative measure for decades.
Aspirin helps prevent heart attacks and strokes.
The new drug offers improved protection against cardiovascular events.

clusters.title: RFK Jr says he’ll ‘fix’ a vaccine program - by canceling compensation for people with vaccine injuries
clusters.neutral_headline: RFK Jr says he’ll ‘fix’ a vaccine program - by canceling compensation for people with vaccine injuries

items.title: RFK Jr says he’ll ‘fix’ a vaccine program - by canceling compensation for people with vaccine injuries
items.standfirst: Changes to an injury compensation program could make it hard to keep vaccines on the market – or make new onesWhile unrest and new vaccine restrictions have kept US health agencies in headlines, there’s one vaccine program in particular that Robert F Kennedy Jr, secretary of the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), recently vowed to “fix”, which experts say could further upend the vaccine industry and prevent people experiencing rare side effects from vaccines from getting financial help.While some changes to the National Vaccine Injury Compensation Program (VICP), which compensates people who suffer very rare side effects from vaccination, must come from Congress, Kennedy could take several actions to reshape or affect the program’s operations. Continue reading...
items.content: Changes to an injury compensation program could make it hard to keep vaccines on the market – or make new onesWhile unrest and new vaccine restrictions have kept US health agencies in headlines, there’s one vaccine program in particular that Robert F Kennedy Jr, secretary of the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), recently vowed to “fix”, which experts say could further upend the vaccine industry and prevent people experiencing rare side effects from vaccines from getting financial help.While some changes to the National Vaccine Injury Compensation Program (VICP), which compensates people who suffer very rare side effects from vaccination, must come from Congress, Kennedy could take several actions to reshape or affect the program’s operations. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Robert F Kennedy Jr. plans to "fix" a vaccine injury program.
Experts suggest this could disrupt the vaccine industry.
The National Vaccine Injury Compensation Program provides aid.
The program compensates those with rare vaccine side effects.
Kennedy could take actions to reshape the program's operations.

clusters.title: Weight loss drugs can halve heart patients’ risk of early death, study finds
clusters.neutral_headline: Weight Loss Drugs Can Halve Heart Patients' Early Death Risk

items.title: Weight loss drugs can halve heart patients’ risk of early death, study finds
items.standfirst: GLP-1 agonists could be given to millions with heart conditions to help them stay out of hospital and live longerWeight loss drugs can reduce by half the risk of heart patients being hospitalised or dying early, according to the largest study of its kind.The class of drugs, known as GLP-1 agonists, have been found to offer “dramatic benefits” to heart patients, significantly cutting their risk of falling seriously ill or dying prematurely from any cause. Continue reading...
items.content: GLP-1 agonists could be given to millions with heart conditions to help them stay out of hospital and live longerWeight loss drugs can reduce by half the risk of heart patients being hospitalised or dying early, according to the largest study of its kind.The class of drugs, known as GLP-1 agonists, have been found to offer “dramatic benefits” to heart patients, significantly cutting their risk of falling seriously ill or dying prematurely from any cause. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Weight loss drugs can reduce heart patients' mortality risk.
The study is the largest of its kind on the topic.
The drugs are known as GLP-1 agonists.
They offer "dramatic benefits" to heart patients.
The drugs significantly cut the risk of serious illness.

clusters.title: Bernie Sanders demands that RFK Jr step down as health secretary
clusters.neutral_headline: Bernie Sanders demands that RFK Jr step down as health secretary

items.title: Bernie Sanders demands that RFK Jr step down as health secretary
items.standfirst: Vermont senator says Kennedy is endangering the health of the American people as head of the US health departmentBernie Sanders has joined in on growing public calls for Donald Trump’s health secretary, Robert F Kennedy Jr, to resign, after recent chaos across US health agencies.In an op-ed published in the New York Times on Saturday, the Vermont senator accused Kennedy of “endangering the health of the American people now and into the future”, adding: “He must resign.” Continue reading...
items.content: Vermont senator says Kennedy is endangering the health of the American people as head of the US health departmentBernie Sanders has joined in on growing public calls for Donald Trump’s health secretary, Robert F Kennedy Jr, to resign, after recent chaos across US health agencies.In an op-ed published in the New York Times on Saturday, the Vermont senator accused Kennedy of “endangering the health of the American people now and into the future”, adding: “He must resign.” Continue reading...

clusters.title: New York City declares Harlem legionnaire’s disease outbreak over
clusters.neutral_headline: New York City declares Harlem legionnaire’s disease outbreak over

items.title: New York City declares Harlem legionnaire’s disease outbreak over
items.standfirst: A hospital’s cooling tower was harboring bacteria as seven people died and 90 were hospitalized over three weeksNew York City has declared the deadly legionnaires’ disease outbreak in central Harlem over, nearly three weeks since it began.On Friday, city health officials announced that there have been no new cases among residents who live or work in the area since 9 August. As of Friday, there have been 114 cases of legionnaires’ disease, with 90 people hospitalized – six of those remaining in hospital – and seven deaths. Continue reading...
items.content: A hospital’s cooling tower was harboring bacteria as seven people died and 90 were hospitalized over three weeksNew York City has declared the deadly legionnaires’ disease outbreak in central Harlem over, nearly three weeks since it began.On Friday, city health officials announced that there have been no new cases among residents who live or work in the area since 9 August. As of Friday, there have been 114 cases of legionnaires’ disease, with 90 people hospitalized – six of those remaining in hospital – and seven deaths. Continue reading...

ai_summary: New York City declared the Harlem outbreak over.
The outbreak began nearly three weeks prior.
The outbreak involved a hospital's cooling tower.
Seven people died and 90 were hospitalized.
There have been no new cases since August 9.

clusters.title: Celebrity chef Gordon Ramsay undergoes treatment to remove skin cancer
clusters.neutral_headline: Celebrity chef Gordon Ramsay undergoes treatment to remove skin cancer

items.title: Celebrity chef Gordon Ramsay undergoes treatment to remove skin cancer
items.standfirst: Ramsay, 58, has posted thanks on social media to ‘incredible’ health workers and urged followers to remember their sun protectionThe celebrity chef Gordon Ramsay has said he has undergone treatment to remove skin cancer, thanking “incredible” health workers for their efforts and urging fans to remember to wear sun protection.Ramsay, 58, said he had basal cell carcinoma, a non-melanoma form of skin cancer, removed, in a post on Instagram. A picture showed dressings below his ear where the cancer had been removed. Continue reading...

A picture showed dressings below his ear where the cancer had been removed. Continue reading...

clusters.title: A report tied Iowa’s water pollution to agriculture. Then the money to promote it mysteriously disappeared
clusters.neutral_headline: A report tied Iowa’s water pollution to agriculture. Then the money to promote it mysteriously disappeared

items.title: A report tied Iowa’s water pollution to agriculture. Then the money to promote it mysteriously disappeared
items.standfirst: Roughly $400,000 in the $1m budget was for public awareness – but those funds were recently ‘zeroed out’When a team of scientists embarked two years ago on a $1m landmark study of Iowa’s persistent water-quality problems, they knew that the findings would be important to share. High cancer rates amid the state’s inability to stem the tide of pollutants flowing into rivers and lakes was a growing public concern.But now, after the completed study pointed to agricultural pollution as a significant source of the key US farm state’s water problems, public officials have quietly stripped funding from plans to promote the study findings, according to sources involved in the project. Continue reading...
items.content: Roughly $400,000 in the $1m budget was for public awareness – but those funds were recently ‘zeroed out’When a team of scientists embarked two years ago on a $1m landmark study of Iowa’s persistent water-quality problems, they knew that the findings would be important to share. High cancer rates amid the state’s inability to stem the tide of pollutants flowing into rivers and lakes was a growing public concern.But now, after the completed study pointed to agricultural pollution as a significant source of the key US farm state’s water problems, public officials have quietly stripped funding from plans to promote the study findings, according to sources involved in the project. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A report linked Iowa's water pollution to agriculture.
Funding for public awareness was removed.
Roughly $400,000 was cut from the budget.
The study cost $1 million.
The study identified agricultural pollution as a source.

clusters.title: New drug hailed as ‘gamechanger’ in tackling stubbornly high blood pressure
clusters.neutral_headline: New Drug Shows Promise in Treating Resistant High Blood Pressure

items.title: New drug hailed as ‘gamechanger’ in tackling stubbornly high blood pressure
items.standfirst: Trials of baxdrostat have produced ‘exciting’ results for people whose hypertension has proved difficult to controlDoctors are hailing a new pill for patients with high blood pressure resistant to existing medication as a “gamechanger” and a “triumph of science”.Globally, more than 1.3 billion people have hypertension. In half of them, their high blood pressure is uncontrolled or resistant to existing treatments. They face a much higher risk of heart attack, stroke, kidney disease and early death. Continue reading...
items.content: Trials of baxdrostat have produced ‘exciting’ results for people whose hypertension has proved difficult to controlDoctors are hailing a new pill for patients with high blood pressure resistant to existing medication as a “gamechanger” and a “triumph of science”.Globally, more than 1.3 billion people have hypertension. In half of them, their high blood pressure is uncontrolled or resistant to existing treatments. They face a much higher risk of heart attack, stroke, kidney disease and early death. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A new drug, baxdrostat, has shown "exciting" results in trials for hypertension patients.
Over 1.3 billion people globally have hypertension, with half uncontrolled or resistant.
Uncontrolled hypertension increases risk of heart attack, stroke, kidney disease, and death.
Doctors are calling the new pill a "gamechanger" and a "triumph of science".
The drug is for patients whose high blood pressure is difficult to control with existing medication.

clusters.title: ‘Sliding into an abyss’: experts warn over rising use of AI for mental health support
clusters.neutral_headline: ‘Sliding into an abyss’: experts warn over rising use of AI for mental health support

items.title: ‘Sliding into an abyss’: experts warn over rising use of AI for mental health support
items.standfirst: Therapists say they are seeing negative impacts of people increasingly turning to AI chatbots for helpVulnerable people turning to AI chatbots instead of professional therapists for mental health support could be “sliding into a dangerous abyss”, psychotherapists have warned.Psychotherapists and psychiatristssaid they were increasingly seeing negative impacts of AI chatbots being used for mental health, such as fostering emotional dependence, exacerbating anxiety symptoms, self-diagnosis, or amplifying delusional thought patterns, dark thoughts and suicide ideation. Continue reading...
items.content: Therapists say they are seeing negative impacts of people increasingly turning to AI chatbots for helpVulnerable people turning to AI chatbots instead of professional therapists for mental health support could be “sliding into a dangerous abyss”, psychotherapists have warned.Psychotherapists and psychiatristssaid they were increasingly seeing negative impacts of AI chatbots being used for mental health, such as fostering emotional dependence, exacerbating anxiety symptoms, self-diagnosis, or amplifying delusional thought patterns, dark thoughts and suicide ideation. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Therapists report negative impacts from people using AI chatbots for mental health.
AI chatbots may foster emotional dependence and worsen anxiety symptoms.
Some users are self-diagnosing or experiencing amplified delusional thoughts.
Experts warn of potential for dark thoughts and increased suicide ideation.
Vulnerable individuals may be at risk by using AI instead of professional therapists.

clusters.title: Doctors develop AI stethoscope that can detect major heart conditions in 15 seconds
clusters.neutral_headline: Doctors develop AI stethoscope that can detect major heart conditions in 15 seconds

items.title: Doctors develop AI stethoscope that can detect major heart conditions in 15 seconds
items.standfirst: Upgraded medical tool has ability to diagnose heart failure, heart valve disease and abnormal heart rhythmsDoctors have successfully developed an artificial intelligence-led stethoscope that can detect three heart conditions in 15 seconds.Invented in 1816, the traditional stethoscope – used to listen to sounds within the body – has been a vital part of every medic’s toolkit for more than two centuries. Continue reading...
items.content: Upgraded medical tool has ability to diagnose heart failure, heart valve disease and abnormal heart rhythmsDoctors have successfully developed an artificial intelligence-led stethoscope that can detect three heart conditions in 15 seconds.Invented in 1816, the traditional stethoscope – used to listen to sounds within the body – has been a vital part of every medic’s toolkit for more than two centuries. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Doctors have created an AI-led stethoscope to detect heart conditions quickly.
The AI stethoscope can diagnose heart failure, valve disease, and rhythm issues.
The device provides diagnoses within a 15-second timeframe.
The traditional stethoscope has been a medical tool for over two centuries.
The upgraded tool uses artificial intelligence to improve diagnostic capabilities.
